image.altText: A white hospital building with blue and green windows, with green trees in front of it

props.synopsis: South Australian public hospitals are under strain with the health department boss declaring a system-wide internal emergency after many staff are sick with COVID.

title.children: 'Significant demand' crippling SA hospitals as 270 staff stay home with COVID

image.altText: A close-up of a little girl sitting on a hospital bed with her arm bandaged and clutching a panda bear.

props.synopsis: Ten-year-old Lama was dressed and her bag packed to escape Gaza after seven months of war when Israel invaded Rafah and closed the only crossing out of the enclave.

title.children: Little Lama was just about to escape a war zone for treatment on her shattered leg. Then Israel invaded Rafah

image.altText: A row of white electric vehicles lined up in a showroom.

props.synopsis:
The rapid rise of Chinese electric vehicles has been met with resistance in the US and Europe. So why are Australians buying them at record levels?

Â

title.children: While the US and EU are putting up roadblocks to Chinese cars, Australia welcomes them with open arms

image.altText: A woman and man both leaving court separately with their faces blurred.

props.synopsis: The lawyer of a woman found guilty of historic child sex abuse in regional South Australia alongside her ex-husband has asked for a lenient sentence for his client, claiming she was also a victim of her then-husband's.

title.children: Woman involved in 'cult-like situation' claims she too was a victim of her husband, court hears

image.altText: A man's hand holding a bottle of beer.

props.synopsis: Advocates and MPs say the government must stand up to the alcohol lobby if it's serious about stopping violence against women and children.

title.children: Should late home delivery of alcohol be banned to help bring down rates of violence against women?

image.altText: A dark sky with trees in the foreground.

props.synopsis: A 5,000 kilometre long cloudband travelling west to east is expected to drench parts of the country over the coming days. Following a second rainband, a separate weather system is threatening to bring heavy rain from NSW to Tasmania from Saturday to Thursday.

title.children: Australia soaked from coast to coast by twin north-west cloudbands and a possible East Coast Low

image.altText: A medium shot of a man in a suit and tie standing and speaking into a microphone at a lecturn. He holds up one clenched hand

props.synopsis: When we consider the desirability of federal hate speech legislation, we quickly run into the freedom-of-speech conundrum. But a line in the sand would be useful.

title.children: Government's pursuit of a hate speech law could take it down another cul-de-sac

image.altText: GreenieCyber3

props.synopsis: A senior Australian official has travelled to Taiwan for high-level talks on countering Chinese cyber threats, amid growing pushback from Beijing against any diplomatic contact with the democratic island.

title.children: Senior Australian security official travels to Taiwan amid diplomatic tensions with China

image.altText: A young woman can be seen in a crowd of people as they march down a city street

props.synopsis: The new government in New Zealand handed down its first full budget and details of its long-promised tax cuts, but as that happened thousands of people rallied for a national day of protest against its policies.

title.children: 'I believe we're on the edge of a revolution': While the NZ government delivered its budget, protests were sweeping the nation

image.altText: A man in a suit and glasses smiles while standing in front of a minister and a Government of South Australia banner

props.synopsis: Media personality and Port Adelaide Football Club chairman David Koch has been appointed as the next South Australian Tourism Commission chair.

title.children: Kochie to bring 'interstate perspective' in new role at SA Tourism Commission

image.altText: Fatima Payman stands with her arms crossed inside her Parliament House office

props.synopsis: A Labor senator who accused Israel of carrying out genocide on the Palestinian people has resigned from her position on two parliamentary foreign affairs committees.

title.children: Labor senator resigns from foreign affairs committees after genocide comments

image.altText: Two people carrying umbrellas walk through a mall with wet pavers

props.synopsis: Adelaide finally sees some decent rain with more expected to fall overnight after experiencing drier than usual conditions since February.

title.children: Adelaide records wettest day in 126 days after dry start to the year

image.altText: Two people walking on the beach in Sydney with rainclouds looming above.

props.synopsis: Every inch of the country is likely to have higher-than-normal temperatures between June and August, according to the Bureau of Meteorology's official winter outlook. Just how wet it will be, however, is less clear.

title.children: BOM's official winter outlook unpacked

image.altText: Brett Button wearing a suit and tie and glasses walks in to court

props.synopsis: The Newcastle District Court has been told sentencing proceedings for a bus driver over a fatal crash in the New South Wales Hunter Valley will be drawn out given the gravity of the case.Â

title.children: Court told sentencing proceedings for Hunter Valley bus crash driver Brett Button will be lengthy

image.altText: Photo of Shane Van Gisbergen's RedBull racecar

props.synopsis: Part of Adelaide's parklands will be turned into a dirt speedway for the 25th year of the Supercars 500 event. While some have criticised the plans, the organiser says the parklands will be left in a "better state than what we found them."

title.children: Temporary dirt speedway set for parklands as Adelaide 500 organisers unveil plans for anniversary event

image.altText: A computer with hacking software on the screen and someone's hands typing on the keyboard

props.synopsis: Around 2 million Australians may be caught up in the Ticketmaster hack. Here's what you should be looking out for and how to protect yourself from hackers and scammers.

title.children: How do I know if I've been hacked? Here's what experts say to look out for in light of the Ticketmaster breach

image.altText: twisted small piece of metal

props.synopsis: The defence barrister of former Jetstar pilot and alleged double murderer Greg Lynn has accused a police witness of lying during a Victorian Supreme Court trial.

title.children: Greg Lynn's barrister accuses police witness of introducing 'half-baked' theory during murder trial

image.altText: Rob Stefanic speaks to Jaala Hinchcliffe at senate estimates

props.synopsis: Sunlight is literally permeating the home of Australia's democracy like never before. Figuratively, though, the government is as opaque as ever â especially the department tasked with running Parliament House.

title.children: Love is in the air at Parliament House and that's probably not a good thing

image.altText: A middle-aged man staring into camera

props.synopsis: The Australian government expresses concerns following the conviction of 14 Hong Kong pro-democracy activists, including Australian dual citizen Gordon Ng, in a landmark subversion trial.

title.children: 'Deeply concerned': Australian found guilty under Hong Kong's National Security Law

image.altText: A woman in a white suit smiles, in the arms of a lawyer.

props.synopsis: Federal Court documents reveal journalist Lisa Wilkinson was billed $8,000 for each full day in court by top defamation lawyer Sue Chrysanthou during Bruce Lehrmann's failed defamation case, as the work to determine what costs should be awarded continues.

title.children: Lisa Wilkinson billed $8,000 per day in court during Bruce Lehrmann's failed defamation trial, documents reveal

image.altText: David Anderson answers questions while facing a senate hearing

props.synopsis: The ABC's managing director David Anderson has defended high-profile journalist Laura Tingle over comments she made about Opposition Leader Peter Dutton, telling a parliamentary committee though her remarks lacked context, her reporting for the public broadcaster "stands the test of scrutiny".

title.children: ABC boss defends Laura Tingle's 'misstep' over Dutton comments, backs her journalism

image.altText: An American Airlines jet lands in front of a 'welcome' sign at LaGuardia airport in New York

props.synopsis: Three of the eight black men allegedly ejected from the flight in January accused the airline of "racial profiling" all black passengers onboard. Â

title.children: US airline sued for allegedly ejecting all black passengers before take-off

image.altText: Carlton players huddle together to celebrate a Patrick Cripps goal

props.synopsis: Carlton move into the top four with a 36-point win over Port Adelaide away from home, led brilliantly by Patrick Cripps and Sam Walsh.

title.children: Captain Cripps leads Carlton to statement win over Port Adelaide

image.altText: NRL player Mitchell Moses of the Eels is hugged by a teammate on the field

props.synopsis: Mitchell Moses breathed new life into Parramatta's beleaguered NRL season, with a 34-22 win over ladder-leading Cronulla Sharks.

title.children: 'It's been a while': Parramatta snap five-game losing streak as Mitchell Moses shines on return from injury

image.altText: Scott de Bruin holding a large tomahawk wagyu cut.

props.synopsis: After years of focusing on the Asian and domestic market, Australia's Wagyu beef producers are turning their attention to the US, where diners can have a steak delivered in a rhinestone-studded briefcase with a laser light show.

title.children: Americans hungry for premium Australian Wagyu beef dish out $1,500 for a steak

image.altText: A bunch of flowers sitting upright against the front door of a house with a chair on the right

props.synopsis: Emergency services were called to a street in Adelaide's west yesterday afternoon in relation to an unresponsive five-year-old girl.

title.children: SA community saddened by 'tragic' death of 5yo girl

image.altText: A photo taken from a drone of a dirt racetrack.

props.synopsis: A new speedway track in South Australia's Bordertown is being hailed as among the best in Australia and even the world after work to exactly replicate one of the most well-renown sprintcar tracks in the United States.

title.children: From almost closing to among the best in world, high hopes for small town speedway

image.altText: LNG tanker leaves Darwin Harbour.

props.synopsis: Independent senator David Pocock calls the Australian gas industry "leeches" in response to a report that found over half of Australia's LNG export facilities pay no royalties.

title.children: 'Daylight robbery': Independents lash Australian gas royalty scheme

image.altText: Arisa Trew smiles at the camera

props.synopsis: Arisa Trew may be just 14 years old, but she is continuing to push the boundaries of the sport, with skateboarding legend Tony Hawk hailing her latest trick.

title.children: 'Glass ceilings are so 2023': Watch as skateboarding legend Tony Hawk hails Aussie teen's world first

props.synopsis: A Michigan man has been ordered to surrender himself to jail after being caught driving without a licence during his court appearance.Â

title.children: US man on suspended licence appears in virtual court via video while driving

image.altText: Annemie Stein with red hair covering her face with a black scarf and wearing sunglasses

props.synopsis: Annemie Stein tells the jury in the murder trial for nine-year-old Charlise Mutten's accused killer she heard the voice of a "little girl" when speaking to her son during a key period in January 2022.

title.children: Mother of Charlise Mutten's accused murderer denies 'cheeky voice' evidence is designed to assist son

image.altText: A young couple stand arm in arm in front of a motel door, she smiles at the camera he smiles at her

props.synopsis: A family who for months had been homeless were able to land jobs and housing when they checked into a country motel for a night of reprieve. They are seeing more and more people booking rooms as a long-term option.

title.children: They wanted a night out of the cold after sleeping rough. Instead, this couple found a home

image.altText: A middle-aged man with a shaved head cuddles his dog with his eyes closed.

props.synopsis: Corey Selby was shot dead by police at Tenterfield in 2023. An inquest into his death has heard of his tragic past and the "missed opportunity" to get him the mental health support he needed.

title.children: Shattered wife tells inquest husband revealed plan to approach police with air rifle

image.altText: A close up of orange letters that read "BHP" affixed to the side of a building.

props.synopsis: Mining giant BHP might have pulled out at the 11th hour in its takeover ambitions for rival Anglo American, but make no mistake â it's a question of when, not if, the Big Australian will come knocking again.

title.children: BHP might have walked away from Anglo American for now, but this isn't the end of the road

image.altText: A graphic with an ex-police officer and a woman smoking in the background

props.synopsis: The black market for cigarettes has exploded in plain sight, costing Australia billions in revenue. Some experts say the high price of cigarettes is to blame.

title.children: Billions are lost to gangs as fake cigarettes flood Australia. Is the war on smoking at a tipping point?
